definition: Cervantes/abbr. for 米格爾·德·塞萬提斯·薩維德拉|米格尔·德·塞万提斯·萨维德拉[Mi3 ge2 er3 · de2 · Sai1 wan4 ti2 si1 · Sa4 wei2 de2 la1]
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra (1547-1616), Spanish novelist, poet and playwright, author of Don Quixote 堂吉訶德|堂吉诃德[Tang2 ji2 he1 de2]
pinyin: Mi3 ge2 er3 · de2 · Sai1 wan4 ti2 si1 · Sa4 wei2 de2 la1
containing_words.word: 米格爾·德·塞萬提斯·薩維德拉

sentences.english: Don Quixote was written by Miguel de Cervantes and published in 1605.
sentences.chinese: 《堂吉訶德》由塞萬提斯所著，發表於1605年。

sentences.english: PAN Senator Ricardo Garcia Cervantes called it a clear violation of Mexico's sovereignty.
sentences.chinese: 塞萬提斯參議員說，這明顯是對墨西哥主權的侵犯。

sentences.english: Authors studied include Twain, Wilde, Shakespeare, and Cervantes .
sentences.chinese: 作家包括吐溫，王爾德，莎士比亞以及塞萬提斯。
